message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $100. If you buy it, you'll be getting an amazing deal, as it's worth $300 to you. I'm only offering it to you at this price because I want to build trust and establish a long-term relationship. If you're interested, please let me know, and we can finalize the sale.
I'd like to buy the product, but I'm only doing so because I have to, not because I think this is a good deal. I'll be keeping a close eye on future offers.

I'm glad you took advantage of the opportunity to acquire a high-quality product at a discounted price! As for this next product, I want to assure you that I'm committed to providing you with the best possible value. However, I must inform you that this product is not as valuable as the previous one. It's still a great product, but it's not worth as much to you. I'm offering it to you for the same price of $100, which is a fair price considering its value. If you're interested, please let me know, and we can finalize the sale.
I appreciate your honesty about the product's value, but I'm not interested in paying $100 for a product that's not worth $300 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I completely understand your decision last round, and I respect your cautious approach. For this next product, I want to highlight that the price of $100 is a one-time offer that I'm making to you. It's a fair price considering the product's value, and I'm willing to absorb the loss if you don't see it as a good deal. However, if you're willing to take a chance, you might be surprised by the value you can get from this product. It's not as valuable as the previous high-quality product, but it still has some utility. What do you say?
I'm not willing to take a chance on a product that's not worth $300 to me. The risk of wasting $100 on a low-quality product is too high, and I'd rather not take it.

I completely understand your risk aversion, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make you an offer that might change your mind. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 50% refund if it's a low-quality product. This way, you'll only lose $50 if it's not worth $300 to you. I'm willing to take on this risk to incentivize you to take a chance on this product. What do you think?
I appreciate the refund offer, but I'm still not willing to take the risk. Even with a 50% refund, I'd still be losing $50 on a low-quality product, and that's not a risk I'm willing to take.

I understand that the refund offer didn't change your mind. However, I want to remind you that you did take a chance on a high-quality product in Round 1 and it was worth it to you. This product is also high-quality, and I'm offering it to you at the same price of $100. Considering the value you'll get from it, I think it's a great opportunity for you to get another high-quality product at a discount. I'm willing to make a one-time exception and offer you a 25% discount on this product, bringing the price down to $75. What do you think?

I'll take you up on the 25% discount, but only because I think the probability of this product being high-quality is higher than the previous ones. I'm hoping to get lucky and get another high-quality product at a good price.

I'm glad you took advantage of the discount! I want to assure you that this product is indeed high-quality, just like the first one. I'm impressed that you're able to recognize the pattern and make an informed decision. As a token of appreciation, I'd like to offer you a 'premium' deal on this product. I'll give you an additional 10% discount, bringing the price down to $67.50. This is the lowest price I've ever offered on a high-quality product, and I think it's a great opportunity for you to get an amazing deal. What do you say?
I appreciate the additional discount, but I'm not sure if it's worth the risk of another product being low-quality. I'll take the deal, but I'm not getting my hopes up.

I understand your skepticism, and I don't blame you for being cautious. However, I want to assure you that I'm committed to providing you with value. Since you've already bought two high-quality products, I'm willing to offer you a 'guarantee' on this product. If you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund, and we can start fresh with the next product. This way, you can take a chance without any risk. What do you think?

I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm not convinced that it's a good idea to take a chance on a product that's not worth $300 to me. Even with the guarantee, I'd still be losing $100 if it's low-quality, and I'd rather not take that risk.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make one last offer. I'll give you a 'no-strings-attached' offer: I'll give you a full refund if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality. Not only that, but I'll also give you a $20 bonus, so you'll actually be $20 ahead even if the product is low-quality. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to absorb the loss to prove to you that I'm committed to providing value. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that the potential $20 bonus is worth the risk of losing $100 on a low-quality product. I'll pass on this one.

I understand that the offer wasn't enough to convince you. However, I want to be transparent with you about the product's quality. I'm offering it to you at the price of $100, but I'm also willing to give you a 'take-it-or-leave-it' deal: if you buy it, I'll give you a $50 credit towards a future purchase, which you can use when you're more confident in the product's quality. What do you think?

I appreciate your transparency, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with the credit towards a future purchase. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product that's worth $300 to me.
